cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 85 miles ESE of Caibarién, Cuba and 275 miles SSE of Miami, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: expected to turn northwest later today, track along the north coast of Cuba, cross the Florida Keys Sunday morning, and make landfall on the southwest coast of Florida before moving north-northwest inland
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Keys Sunday morning followed by the southwest coast of Florida (Naples–Everglades area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of the Volusia/Brevard County Line to Fernandina Beach
weather_observation.warning_coast: Volusia/Brevard County Line southward around the Florida peninsula to Anclote River
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida peninsula coastline, Keys, and adjacent Atlantic and Gulf coasts
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm to hurricane-force winds possible; 34-kt probability peaks at 52%, 50-kt probability 46% over next 5 days
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft inundation possible along the Brevard County coast including Port Canaveral during high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–15 inches with locally higher amounts up to 20 inches, leading to flash-flood risk
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, dangerous rip currents, and isolated tornadoes beginning Saturday midday
